channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Dungiven: Viable pipe bomb found during security alert
item.description: It was a "completely reckless" act to leave a device in a residential area, police say.

item.title: Driver killed in single-car crash in County Tyrone
item.description: Darren Canavan, 31, was pronounced dead at the scene on the Kilmascally Road in Ardboe.

item.title: Queen's University: Anger over withdrawal of halls offer
item.description: Eóin Deery and Pádraig Muldoon had paid a deposit and been due to get the keys this week.

item.title: Covid-19: Alliance MLA calls for greater clarity on schools' isolation policy
item.description: The chair of Stormont's health committee wants to see clearer messaging on stopping the spread of Covid.

item.title: Belfast Trust appeals for off-duty nurses to come in
item.description: The trust says it is under "extreme pressure" caring for an increasing number of sick patients.

item.title: NI Protocol: Five things we learned from Sefcovic visit
item.description: EU chief Maros Sefcovic spent two days in Northern Ireland - what did the visit reveal?

item.title: All-Ireland final: Tyrone players given heroes' welcome
item.description: Thousands of fans cheer on the All-Ireland champions at their home ground of Healy Park in Omagh.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records six coronavirus-linked deaths, 1,031 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,453.

item.title: Donegal mica: Crumbling house homeowners protest
item.description: Protesters want the Irish government to revamp a support scheme which they say is not fit for purpose.

item.title: Lorry driver shortage: 'I'll never be stuck for work'
item.description: Amid a shortage of lorry drivers across the UK, people in Northern Ireland are training for the job.

item.title: Northern Ireland landscape: Searching for the perfect picture
item.description: BBC News NI speaks to people spending their spare time looking for sunrises, storm clouds and stars.

item.title: Covid-19: Limelight in Belfast vaccine venue for young people
item.description: The chief medical officer hopes to get at least 90% of the eligible population of NI vaccinated.

item.title: International students 'worth £260m to NI economy'
item.description: South Belfast benefitted most as the highest number of non-UK students live there, says a report.

item.title: Covid-19: Schools safe for children and staff, says CMO
item.description: Sir Michael McBride says "certainty of long-term harm to many children" from not attending school.

item.title: Covid-19: Rules ease on dining, dancing and live shows in NI
item.description: The hospitality industry preparing for the removal of table service rules this evening.

item.title: Covid-19: Mallon announces plan to attract new taxi drivers
item.description: Some fees will be waived and a fare review will be launched says the Infrastructure minister.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records 64 more coronavirus-linked deaths
item.description: The figure is 11 more than the previous week and brings the statistic agency's total to 3,246.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Covid-19: Pupils will not have to 'routinely self-isolate'
item.description: The Public Health Agency (PHA) will begin tracing close contacts in schools on Friday.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: 'It changed the world and reporting on it changed me'
item.description: BBC journalist Mark McCleary recalls the surreal experience of being in New York after the attack.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Irish NYPD officer recalls horror of aftermath
item.description: Paul McCormack, originally from Ballybofey, describes the horrific scenes that met first responders.

item.title: Syrian refugees in NI 'trapped' in poverty and trauma
item.description: Healthcare access is described as "abysmal", while language barriers remained an ongoing problem.

item.title: Holy Cross dispute: The terror and the trauma recalled 20 years on
item.description: A teacher, priest and minister recall the dispute outside Holy Cross Primary School in Belfast in 2001.

item.title: Tyrone fans react to Sam coming home
item.description: Fans hail the new All-Ireland football champions, 13 years after the county last won the Sam Maguire cup.

item.title: Powerchair football: 'My hat-trick got Northern Ireland to the World Cup'
item.description: Patrick Cumiskey was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy when he was eight months old.

item.title: Tyrone player turns Fermanagh school red and white
item.description: Tyrone colours crossed county lines as a Fermanagh school turned red and white to support a teacher.

item.title: The £4.5m plan to protect Rathlin Island's seabirds
item.description: Rathlin Island is aiming to protect seabirds with a £4.5m project tackling invasive predators.

item.title: Claudy bomb: Families reach settlement with PSNI and government
item.description: Nine people were killed when three bombs exploded in the County Londonderry village in July 1972.

item.title: Philip O’Doherty: 'How I built a billion-pound company'
item.description: Philip O'Doherty founded E&I Engineering, which will be sold to a US firm in a deal worth $2bn (£1.45bn).

item.title: Sinn Féin selects Pádraig Delargy and Ciara Ferguson as new Foyle MLAs
item.description: They succeed Martina Anderson and Karen Mullan who stood down after a party restructure in Foyle.

item.title: Donegal engineering firm to be sold for £1.4bn
item.description: E&I Engineering, founded by Derry City chairman Philip O'Doherty, is being sold to a US-based company.

item.title: Rainbow crossing: NI's first rainbow crossing unveiled in Londonderry
item.description: It links the Guildhall to the Peace Bridge and aims to support the city's LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: Covid-19: 90% of adults in Republic of Ireland now fully vaccinated
item.description: The vaccine rollout is to continue across the country, with children 12 and over able to receive a jab.

item.title: County Kerry: Gardaí continues investigation into Ballyreahan deaths
item.description: The bodies of three members of the same family were found on Tuesday.

item.title: Leona Maguire: 'Incredible' homecoming for star Irish golfer
item.description: County Cavan turns out to welcome home Leona Maguire who helped Europe win the Solheim Cup.

item.title: County Kerry: Criminal investigation launched after three found dead
item.description: Gardaí (Irish police) say a firearm was discovered near to the body of one of the deceased.

item.title: Republic of Ireland to ban the sale of polluting solid fuels
item.description: The new rules, which will make Ireland a low-smoke zone, are expected to be in place within a year.
